article.headline: Jackson St. 84, Grambling St. 80
article.story: JACKSON, Miss. -- Garrison Johnson had 26 points and Grant Maxey scored five of his 22 points in overtime to help Jackson State beat Grambling State 84-80 on Saturday night, extending its winning streak to eight games. Jackson State (13-13, 12-2 Southwestern Athletic Conference), which started the season 1-12, remains undefeated at home. Johnson scored eight straight points to give Jackson State a 66-58 lead with 4:45 left in regulation, but Grambling State (6-19, 4-10) tied the score at 72-72 on two Donald Qualls free throws with 7 seconds to go. In overtime, Maxey had two free throws and a dunk to put Jackson State ahead 78-74 with 1:29 left. Jeremy Caldwell added 19 points for Jackson State. Qualls scored 18 points for Grambling State, which lost its fifth straight game, while Marcus Coleman had 16, Ariece Perkins 15 and Jordan Lemon 14.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
